content: What is the name of the famous equation in physics, proposed by Albert Einstein, that describes the equivalence of energy and mass?

The famous equation in physics proposed by Albert Einstein that describes the equivalence of energy and mass is E=mc². This equation expresses the idea that energy (E) and mass (m) are interchangeable; they are different forms of the same thing. The 'c²' represents the speed of light squared, which is the conversion factor between mass and energy. This equation has profound implications in physics and has been experimentally verified in numerous ways.
